{% raw %}

class LookbackBlock[source]

LookbackBlock(Unit:Module, ni:int, fold:int, stride:int=1, **kwargs) :: Module

Basic block of lookback ResNet

fold=2
m = LookbackBlock(mbconv, ni=16, fold=fold, nh=32)

xs = [torch.randn(2,16,32,32)] * fold

xs2 = m(*xs)

len(xs2), [x.shape for x in xs2]

(2, [torch.Size([2, 16, 32, 32]), torch.Size([2, 16, 32, 32])])

class ExpandBlock[source]

ExpandBlock(Unit:Module, ni:int, fold1:int, fold2:int, stride:int=1, **kwargs) :: Module

Expand block of lookback ResNet

m = ExpandBlock(mbconv, ni=16, fold1=fold, fold2=3, stride=2, nh=32)

xs2 = m(*xs)

len(xs2), [x.shape for x in xs2]

(3,
 [torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]),
  torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]),
  torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16])])

class LookbackNet[source]

LookbackNet(Stem, Unit, folds:tuple, ni:int, num_nodes:tuple, bottle_scale:int=1, first_downsample:bool=False, tail_all:bool=True, c_in:int=3, c_out:int=10, **kwargs) :: Module

A lookback resnet, using Expand.

num_nodes = [8,9,9,9]
folds = [4,4,4,4]
ni = 64
bottle_scale = 1
model = LookbackNet(Stem=conv_bn, Unit=mbconv, folds=folds, ni=ni, num_nodes=num_nodes, 
                bottle_scale=bottle_scale, tail_all=True, ks=3, c_out=100, zero_bn=True)
num_params(model)

tensor(1199012)
x = torch.randn(2,3,64,64)

with torch.autograd.set_detect_anomaly(True):
    out = model(x)
    out.mean().backward()
{% endraw %}
